title: About
text:
I am Jack Xu, a thirteen year old who loves birds!
My GitHub account: https://www.github.com/jackxu3
My email: bluebird.jack.xu@gmail.com
My project is about predicting wildfire proximity affects migratory birds with altitude, speed, and direction. The underlying R code of the plots were written by AI tools.
GitHub repository link: https://github.com/jackxu3/fires-and-birds
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Free Data Science Bootcamp.

title: Model
text:
Linear Regression Model \[
y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{speed\_2d} + \beta_2 \cdot \text{altitude} + \beta_3 \cdot \text{direction}
\]
Fitted \[
\hat{y} = 0.244 + 0.159 \cdot \text{speed\_2d} - 0.284 \cdot \text{altitude} - 0.0209 \cdot \text{direction}
\]
Statistics


# A tibble: 4 × 7
  term        estimate std.error statistic p.value conf.low conf.high
  <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
1 (Intercept)   0.244      0.219     1.11  0.275     -0.204    0.691 
2 speed_2d      0.159      0.136     1.17  0.251     -0.118    0.436 
3 altitude     -0.284      0.101    -2.80  0.00885   -0.491   -0.0768
4 direction    -0.0209     0.144    -0.145 0.886     -0.315    0.273
